ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: Question 5) I tried emailing instructors several times and received no responces.
Q9. A visit to the herbarium now and then would be helpful!
An absolutely wonderful course!
The instruction in the classroom was superb. The stature of the scientists was incredible, this was a rare opportunity.
The wealth of the instructors' experience and knowledge about the subject.

Sitting in on the conversations and discussions between the professors.There was a tremendous amount of information presented and their interactions were helpful for developing my own opinions on the topic.
Seminar format, open to discussion, outstanding invited speakers, very knowledgeable professors, readings.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: The very heterogenous class does not bond well. Interaction between the students can be iproved by having a group activity, more detailed instroductions etc.
I think it would be most improved with an overall presentation of geologic time at the beginning of the class to give perspective on the various time periods discussed.
Distribution of time between lectures/discussion among professors and students participation

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Prof Hickey was very helpful and provided great guidance in the class paper that I wrote. Prof Donoghue was also very good at the administrative duties of the class.
I was not aware of a TA.
Could not have been better!
Very helpful
Professors L. Hickey, P. Crane, M Donoghue: Always available, very good quality

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: I took this class to pursue my initial passion in biology and evolution. While it does not fit entirely with my current program of classes, if I had taken this class earlier in my 2 years at Yale, I may reconsider and choose the classes/program that I will take over the two years.
With a background in field botany, this course was to integrate classroom knowledge and the phylogenetic tree.
The most relevant course of the program given my academic background in paleobotany and plant phylogeny.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: It was a rare opportunity to study with these three scientists.
For the distinguished faculty and curiosity about the topic.
The topic was very interesting and it seemed like a unique opportunity to investigate a topic I would not have otherwise studied.
Very important for my research.Outstanding professors.Very relevant/polemic topic in the plant sciences

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes, definitely
Yes, other than email communication.
Absolutely. Every class was a lot of learning.
Absolutely
Yes.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes
I got more than I expected!
Yes.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Know geologic time and how it relates to the evolution of plants.
It is a fascinating discussion that you will enjoy every week.Go through the readings carefully and prepare your questions for the class.
Very interesting course for students interested in botany, plant systematics and evolution.
